required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Early Rehabilitation After Hand or Wrist Ambulatory Surgery : How to Preserve Locomotion at Home Without Rebound Pain?
clinical_study.official_title: Early Rehabilitation After Hand or Wrist Ambulatory Surgery : How to Preserve Locomotion at Home Without Rebound Pain? Study Walant " Wide Awake Local Anesthesia No Tourniquet " Versus Axillary Brachial Plexus Block.

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this retrospective study is to compare the analgesic efficacy of Walant " Wide Awake Local Anesthesia No Tourniquet " with lidocaine and bupivacaine versus axillary brachial plexus block using mepivaca√Øne, both performed by anesthesiologists, after hand or wrist ambulatory surgery.
The main objective is to prove that Walant block improve pain relief at home measuring time to first analgesic request.
The secondary objectives are to compare maximal pain, consumption of supplementary analgesics, and the duratin of sensory block between groups.

detailed_description.textblock:
data will be collected on patient records and will be compared between groups of regional anesthesia.
Data will be :
- time to first analgesic request
- sensory block
- rescue analgesia during the first 24 hours after surgery
- maximal pain score during the first 24 hours after surgery
- patient satisfaction of managing care

primary_outcome.description: time to first rescue analgesic request (opioid)

secondary_outcome.measure: maximal pain score during the first 24 hours after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Pain assessments during first 24 hours : maximal pain score during the first 24 hours after surgery

secondary_outcome.measure: total rescue analgesia amounts the first 24 hours after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Pain assessments during first 24 hours : total rescue analgesia amounts the first 24 hours after surgery
Pain assessments during first 24 hours : duration of sensory block

intervention.description: Injection of local anesthetics by a regional anesthesia named Walant block (Wide Awak Local anesthesia No Tourniquet)or by axillary brachial plexus block.

study_pop.textblock: All adults patients scheduled for hand or wrist ambulatory surgery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All adults patients scheduled for hand or wrist ambulatory surgery since 2016
Exclusion criteria:
- NA
